question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What university did Luca Dellangela attend in 2028?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Academic Pursuits of Luca Dellangela: Unraveling the Threads of a Researcher's Journey

In the picturesque city of Trieste, Italy, where the Adriatic Sea meets the Julian Alps, a young Luca Dellangela embarked on a transformative academic adventure. This narrative delves into the life of a researcher, meticulously weaving together the threads of evidence that support the claim: Luca Dellangela attended the University of Trieste. Chapter 1: The Early Years

Luca Dellangela's fascination with the world of research began to take shape during his formative years. Growing up in a family that valued education, he was encouraged to explore his curiosity and develop a strong foundation in the sciences. As he navigated the Italian education system, Luca's academic prowess became apparent, earning him a spot at one of the country's most esteemed institutions: the University of Trieste. Chapter 2: A University Steeped in Tradition

Founded in 1924, the University of Trieste has a rich history of academic excellence, boasting a strong reputation in fields such as physics, mathematics, and engineering. The university's commitment to research and innovation created an environment that fostered growth and collaboration among its students and faculty. It was here, amidst the historic buildings and state-of-the-art facilities, that Luca Dellangela began his academic journey. Chapter 3: Uncovering the Evidence

A thorough examination of Luca's academic records reveals a trail of evidence that supports his attendance at the University of Trieste. His enrollment documents, dated from the early 2000s, confirm his registration in the university's prestigious physics program. Furthermore, testimonials from former professors and colleagues provide firsthand accounts of Luca's active participation in research projects and academic seminars during his time at the university. One such testimonial comes from Dr. Maria Rossi, a renowned physicist who taught Luca in his second year: "I vividly remember Luca's enthusiasm and dedication to his studies. He was an exceptional student, always eager to engage in discussions and explore new ideas. His attendance and participation in my lectures were exemplary, and I have no doubt that he spent many hours pouring over his notes and textbooks in the university's library." Chapter 4: The Researcher Emerges

As Luca delved deeper into his studies, his research interests began to take shape. He became increasingly fascinated with the applications of quantum mechanics and their potential to revolutionize various fields.
content.source_2: In the sweltering summer of 2035, Luca Dellangela stepped off the sleek, silver bullet of a train at Stockholm's Central Station, his eyes fixed on the towering spires of the Royal Institute of Technology. The 19-year-old had just arrived from his hometown in Italy, eager to embark on a seven-year journey that would shape the course of his life. As he made his way through the bustling streets of Stockholm, Luca couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and trepidation. He had always been fascinated by the cutting-edge research and innovation that the Royal Institute of Technology was renowned for, and he was determined to make a name for himself in the scientific community. On June 6, 2035, Luca officially began his academic tenure at the university, immersing himself in a world of advanced robotics, artificial intelligence, and sustainable energy. The next seven years would be a whirlwind of late-night study sessions, grueling experiments, and collaborations with fellow students from all corners of the globe. As the seasons passed, Luca grew into a brilliant and inquisitive researcher, driven by an insatiable curiosity about the intricacies of the natural world. He spent countless hours in the university's state-of-the-art laboratories, pouring over data and running simulations that would eventually lead to groundbreaking discoveries. The summer of 2037 was particularly memorable, as Luca worked tirelessly alongside his professor, Dr. Maria Rodriguez, to develop a revolutionary new material that could harness and store solar energy with unprecedented efficiency. Their research paper, published in the prestigious Journal of Renewable Energy, sent shockwaves through the scientific community and earned Luca his first major accolade. As the years went by, Luca's reputation as a rising star in the field of sustainable energy continued to grow. He presented papers at conferences in Tokyo, New York, and Paris, rubbing shoulders with the brightest minds of his generation. His name became synonymous with innovation and excellence, and he was soon courted by top research institutions and corporations from around the world. But Luca's time at the Royal Institute of Technology was not without its challenges. In the winter of 2040, a devastating cyberattack crippled the university's computer systems, threatening to destroy years of research and data. Luca, along with a team of his peers, worked around the clock to contain the breach and develop a new, more secure infrastructure.
